noun.description: A wrong guess; (Bridge) an incorrect guess at the situation regarding a (stated) suit.

verb.description: To guess wrongly at (a situation, outcome, etc.).
Bridge. To guess wrongly at (the situation regarding a (stated) suit).

origin: 1940s; earliest use found in The Frederick News. From misguess<br>mid 16th century; earliest use found in Thomas More (1478–1535), lord chancellor, humanist, and martyr. From mis- + guess.
